name: St. Bonaventure
summary: Bonaventure was an Italian Franciscan theologian and philosopher. He was a contemporary of Thomas Aquinas and is considered one of the greatest medieval theologians. He served as Minister General of the Franciscan Order and was made a cardinal. He is known for his synthesis of Augustinian theology with Aristotelian philosophy and is venerated as a Doctor of the Church.

writings.title: The Journey of the Mind to God
